wiki.text:
A 'fact' (derived from the Latin factum, see below) is something that has really
occurred or is actually the case. The usual test for a statement of fact is
verifiability, that is whether it can be proven to correspond to experience.
Standard reference works are often used to check facts. Scientific facts are
verified by repeatable experiments.
wiki.title: fact
